text.div:
Segment_AL1_Map (http://hl7.org/fhir/v2-tofhir)

Mapping from https://www.hl7.org/v2 to https://www.hl7.org/fhir

ACTIVE (not intended for production usage). Published on Mar 1, 2020, 12:00:00 AM by HL7 International (HL7 Orders and Observations Workgroup: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/OO/v2-to-FHIR+IG, Keith W. Boone: kboone@ainq.com). Copyright (c) 2020, HL7 International, Inc., All Rights Reserved.

This ConceptMap represents the mapping from the HL7 V2 AL1 Segment to the FHIR AllergyIntolerance Resource representing that segment.


Source CodeRelationshipDestination CodeComment
AL1-2is equivalent toAllergyIntolerance.categoryThe FHIR table has a "required" binding. Do we need to expand the values in the FHIR table? Could other be used for: Miscellaneous allergy Miscellaneous contraindication Animal Allergy HL70127 is a user defined table
AL1-2is equivalent toAllergyIntolerance.type
AL1-3is equivalent toAllergyIntolerance.code
AL1-4is equivalent toAllergyIntolerance.reaction.severityHL70128 is a user defined table Consider using AllergyIntolerance.criticality
AL1-4is equivalent toAllergyIntolerance.reaction.severity.extension-data-absent-reason
AL1-4is equivalent toAllergyIntolerance.criticality
AL1-5is equivalent toAllergyIntolerance.reaction.manifestation.textAllergyIntolerance.reaction can repeat, presumably to capture both multiple manifestations of the reaction (rash and nausea) as well as reactions to independent exposures (last week and last month) - we may want to confirm this understanding.
AL1-6is equivalent toAllergyIntolerance.onsetDateTimeWithdrawn as of 2.7, Refer to IAM-11 Onset or IAM-13 Reported Date

name: Segment_AL1_Map
description: This ConceptMap represents the mapping from the HL7 V2 AL1 Segment to the FHIR AllergyIntolerance Resource representing that segment.

target.comment:
The FHIR table has a "required" binding. Do we need to expand the values in the FHIR table?

Could other be used for:
Miscellaneous allergy
Miscellaneous contraindication
Animal Allergy

HL70127 is a user defined table

HL70128 is a user defined table
Consider using AllergyIntolerance.criticality

AllergyIntolerance.reaction can repeat, presumably to capture both multiple manifestations of the reaction (rash and nausea) as well as reactions to independent exposures (last week and last month) - we may want to confirm this understanding.
Withdrawn as of 2.7, Refer to IAM-11 Onset or IAM-13 Reported Date
